title: Mastering Marketplace Integration: The Core Pipeline
author: Ekobol Integration Team
image_alt: Unified integration hub connecting multiple e-commerce platforms
image_caption: Connect once. Sell everywhere. The unified API bridge.
p1: Stop managing 5 different dashboards. Ekobol's Unified Integration Pipeline allows you to funnel all your orders, inventory, and customer messages into a single command center. We normalize data streams from high-volume platforms like Trendyol to global giants like Amazon.
p2: The Integration Hub is where you manage all external connections. Access it via Settings → Integrations.
li1_text: Trendyol, Hepsiburada, Amazon (NA/EU), Etsy, N11, Çiçeksepeti.
li3_text: Yurtiçi Kargo, Aras Kargo, Paraşüt, BizimHesap.
p3: Connect Turkey's largest marketplace in minutes.
li4_text: Log in to Trendyol Partner Center.
li5_text: Navigate to Account Information → API Key.
li6_text: Copy your 'Supplier ID' (Satıcı ID), 'API Key', and 'API Secret'.
li8_text: Paste credentials into the encrypted fields.
li9_text: Click 'Connect' and wait for the green status indicator.
p4: Note: Trendyol API credentials reset periodically. If sync stops, check if you need to regenerate keys.
p5: Connect your Amazon Seller Central account for global reach.
li10_text: In Ekobol, select region (North America, Europe, etc.).
li11_text: Click 'Authorize with Amazon' - you will be redirected to Seller Central.
li12_text: Login and approve the 'Ekobol' application permission request.
li13_text: You will be redirected back to Ekobol with a success message.
li14_text: Ekobol automatically detects FBA orders and marks them as 'Managed by Amazon'.
p6: Ideal for handmade and unique goods export.
li17_text: Click 'Allow Access' on the confirmation screen.
li18_text: Configure 'Currency Conversion' if your shop currency differs from your bank account.
li19_text: Enable 'Inventory Sync' to prevent overselling on unique items.
p7: Manage your own website alongside marketplaces.
li20_text: Go to WordPress Admin → WooCommerce → Settings → Advanced → REST API.
li23_text: Enter your full website URL (e.g., https://myshop.com) and keys in Ekobol.
p8: Define how data flows between Ekobol and connected platforms.
li24_text: Who controls stock? Recommended: Ekobol (Ekobol updates Marketplaces).
li25_text: Enable to push price updates from Ekobol. Disable if you use marketplace-specific repricers.
li26_text: Set automatic price adjustments per channel (e.g., Etsy Level = Base Price + 15%).
li27_text: Configure VAT rules for different regions.
p9: Always verify the bridge before going fully live.
li28_text: Change stock of a test SKU in Ekobol (e.g., 10 → 9). check marketplace panel in 60 seconds.
li29_text: Create a dummy order on your test site (if possible) and see if it appears in Ekobol.
li30_text: Check 'Sync Logs' for any error messages (e.g., 'SKU not found', 'Auth failed').
p10: Integration issues are usually permission or data related.
li31_text: API keys expired or changed. Regenerate and update in Ekobol.
li32_text: Too many requests. Ekobol automatically queues requests, but high volume may cause delays.
li33_text: Marketplace SKU must match Ekobol SKU exactly. Use 'SKU Mapping' tool if they differ.
li34_text: Order Splitting: Automatically split orders with items from multiple warehouses.
li35_text: Route Optimization: Auto-assign shipping carrier based on destination.
li36_text: Inventory Buffers: Hide 'X' units from marketplaces to prevent overselling.
li38_text: Review 'Sync Error' logs weekly to catch unlinked products.
li39_text: Update tokens annually (or as required by platform policies).
